lenders.name: Dana
lenders.loan_because: People look for a hand up, not a hand out.  Everyone needs help from time to time - this is just my way of giving back to the universe. As the loans get repaid, the money gets sent back out for others so the cycle of change and growth continues.

lenders.name: Kathleen
lenders.loan_because: I simply want to assist others to come to a place of health and security.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an artist and I design many different things including jewelry, paintings and also commercial art such as brochures and web pages.

lenders.name: Stefanie
lenders.loan_because: To share with those less fortunate than myself in an effort to help them become more independent.

lenders.name: Kat
lenders.loan_because: I want to ease the lives of those less fortunate.

lenders.name: Tyler
lenders.loan_because: If people need help in the world, I'll be there to help them.

lenders.name: Bonnie

lenders.name: Anastasia

lenders.occupational_info: I work in a home with mentally ill men, helping them gain living skills so hopefully they will be well and be able to live on their own one day.

lenders.occupational_info: We are 10-11 year old girls trying to help our world as best as we can! We have gone from normal community girls to saving the world super heros! We want to help!

lenders.name: The Hurley Nelsons

Giving is the most wonderful gift, the gift to give is truly powerful!

...to inspire others to loan.

lenders.loan_because: we are not all lucky enough to be born into a life where we have opportunities.  To help in a small way to those who are trying to create theirs is the minimum we can do.  Well done to Kiva.

lenders.name: Joanne
lenders.loan_because: well, right now I have stopped loaning until Kiva bans cockfighting loans. I am at this time withdrawing my monthly repayments  and investing in such as  www.energyincommon.org . Most of my MF funds are in Oikocredit, and some through MicroPlace.com . My real interests are not just in supporting individuals, but also their communities and the planet. Investing at energyincommon will allow me to make contributions to better health and air in communities, to the expansion of solar solutions, and to the health of the planet.

lenders.name: Josef
lenders.loan_because:
I have the financial means to do so with much ease. I remember what It was like for me to stumble around and struggle with money to get started or to just keep it going through lean times. 

Being that I run a business myself helping others make alot of money, Kiva.Org suits my personality and my way of doing business perfectly as I can relate to alot of the business owners here.
lenders.occupational_info: In simple terms: Help several hundred people make alot of money online by social media websites (mostly) online. I make several thousands per month and I use it to grow myself and my team to even greater financial success.

lenders.name: Gail
lenders.occupation: I teach managers to be leaders
lenders.occupational_info: I help people learn to lead and manage others at work

lenders.loan_because: I like to help people, especially those that need it more than others!

lenders.name: Chris

lenders.occupational_info: I am teaching english in china

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: I saw the value of microloans when I lived in South Africa. They are a powerful force for positive change in people's lives. They are also low risk and unlike many charities, every penny I loan gets directly to the person who needs it.

lenders.name: Josh
lenders.loan_because: Kiva entrepreneurs are at the forefront of their society’s growth

lenders.name: Pamela

lenders.occupational_info: I am a Certified Public Manager and Certified Arborist, and a physicist. I teach for Florida State University as well as for some private companies. I also do management consultation, and I grind stumps for my husband's tree service!

Franklin D. Roosevelt

lenders.occupation: CEO of an Internet Company: CitiesUnlimited.com

lenders.name: Ingraham Economics
lenders.loan_because: As a class, we have studied the impacts of microloans on less developed nations of the world.  Many of us got a chance to go see Muhammad Yunus speak at the University of Washington this year and were moved by the simplicity of his approach.  We wanted to do something after two years together as a class and decided to try and raise money to loan "person to person" though Kiva.  We were lucky to make the aquaintance of Professor Yoram Bauman (of the University of Washington - www.standupdeconomist.com)  and he agreed to give a performance as the world's only standup economist at our school.  He did this free of charge and we are quite thankful to him.  We raised $1,050 in donations from the evening's event.
lenders.occupational_info: Besides the teacher, we are all students who will be going to different colleges and universities around the world next fall.  Presently, we are finishing up at Ingraham High School in Seattle.

lenders.name: Tim F.
lenders.loan_because:
It's the right thing for me to do.  

I read something, somewhere that, "...world poverty is one of the most offensive things we can do to God..."

Helping people establish and maintain their own dignity in this life is paramount to my beliefs in spiritual evolution.  

One of my intentions in this life is to do my part to create peace and dignity in this world.

"May the Peace of God be with you" - St. Francis of Assisi.
lenders.occupational_info:
My work is Financial Analysis, it's probably boring to most people!  I track, forecast, maintain and establish large budgets.  

It is rewarding in the aspect of challenge, but it doesn't provide much people interaction.  

As part of my community involvement, I am also a member of a Board of Directors for a small non-profit organization in my community.
